WILLIAM MEAD, 183 acs. Halifax Co.
on both sides of Black Water Riv.; 27
Jun MDCCLIV [sic. It should read
MDCCLXIV = 1764], in the 4th year of
our Reign, George the Third and issued
by Francis Fauquier Esq. our Lieutenant
Governor and Commander in Chief of
our said Colony and Dominion at
Williamsburg, p.557. £1.

WILLIAM MOORE, 80 acs. Augusta
Co. ona Br. of Buffalo Cr. in the fork of
James Riv.; adj. Henry Kirkum; 27 Jun
1764, p.557. 10 Shill. Whereas by Pat.
13 Jun 1755 Gtd. John Nelson [PB 32,
p-600] and whereas the sd John Nelson
hath failed to pay Quitrents and to make
Cultiv. and Improv. and Andrew Hays
hath made Humble suit and hath
obtained a G. for the same which he hath
assigned to William Moore.

JACOB MIRE, 50 acs. Augusta Co. on
Shanando Riv. adj. his own Land; 27 Jun
1764, p.558. 5 Shill.

JOHN MASON, JUNIOR, 68% acs.
Sussex Co.; adj. John Underhill in the
College Line, sd Underhill's new Survey,
Hugh Ivey, Thomas Adkins & John
Wilkerson; 27 Jun 1764, p.559. 10 Shill.

JOHN PLEASANTS, 32 acs. Goochland Co. on Snow Quarter Br. on the S
side of James Riv., adj. William Farris,
Benjamin Harrison Dec'd & John
Salmon; 27 Jun 1764, p.559. 5 Shill.

JOHN PETTWAY, 204 acs. Bruns-wick
Co. adj. James Russell, Mabry, William
Smith & Johnson; 27 Jun 1764, p.560. 5
Shill. 164 acs. part being Part of a Pat.
for 485 acs. Gtd. to Hinshiah Mabury 5
Nov 1724/25 the Right & Title whereof
is since become vested in the sd John
Pettway And 40 acs. the residue never
before Granted.

DAVID PATTERSON & JACOB
LINDSEY, Church Wardens of Tillotson
Parish for them and their Successors for
a Glebe, 34 acs. Albemarle Co. on both
sides of a Br. of Taylor's Cr. [of Slate
Riv.]; adj. the Glebe Land, Nicholas
Morris, David Davidson & Edmund
Davidson; 27 Jun 1764, p.561. 5 Shill.
Unto the sd David Patterson & Jacob
Lindsey and to their Successors the
Church wardens of Tillotson Parish for
the time being, for ever to be set apart for
a Glebe To the only Use and Behoof of
the Minister of the sd Parish of Tillotson
and his Successors for ever. [For the
other Glebe land see PB 27, p.411 to
Arthur McDaniel; for Edmund
Davidson's see PB 28, p.184 to Arthur
McDaniel & for David Davidson's see
PB 28, p.178 to William Perkins]

WILLIAM QUARLES, 15 acs. Caroline
Co. in Pamunka Riv. commonly known
by the name of Flemings Islands, Beg. at
the Eastermost end of the largest of these
Islands, thence up the main Stream of the
sd Riv. which divides those Islands from
Hanover Co., to the uppermost end of
the next Largest Island, thence down the
main Stream of sd Riv. that parts those
Islands from a Tract of 400 acs. formerly
Gtd. to Robert Fleming; 27 Jun 1764,
p.562. 5 Shill.

CLEMENT READ, 687 acs. Lunenburg
Co. on the S side of Little Roan Oak
Riv., adj. John Towns; 27 Jun 1764,
p.563. £1.S15. 354 acs. part Gtd. James
Terry by Pat. 30 Aug 1743 [PB 20,
p.562] the Right & Title whereof is since
become vested in the sd Clement Read
And 333 acs. the residue never before
Gtd.

HERMON RIEVES, 128 acs. Brunswick
Co. on the S side of Meherin Riv., adj.
Carter, Dupray, Hicks, Sikes & Brown;
27 Jun 1764, p.564. 15 Shill.

WILLIAM SPENCER, 110 acs. Bedford
Co. on both sides of Falling Cr.; 27 Jun
1764, p.565. 15 Shill.

BENJAMIN SYKES, 62 acs. Brunswick
Co. on the S side Meherrin Riv., in a
Meadow; adj. Brown, Hicks & sd Sykes
old Land; 27 Jun 1764, p.565. 10 Shill.

DAVID STEEL, 50 acs. Augusta Co. on
halfway Cr. a Br. of James Riv., crossing
the Great Road, adj. Burdin; 27 Jun
1764, p.566. 5 Shill.

VALENTINE SEVEAR, 200 acs.
Augusta Co., Beg. on a Stony Hill on the
SE side of Smith's Cr, crossing Daniel
James's br.; 27 Jun 1764, p.567. for the
Importation of 4 Persons whose names
are James Porteus, John Roe, Patrick
McDonald & Daniel Warner.

VALENTINE SEVEAR, 310 acs.
Augusta Co. on the S side of the North
Riv. of Shanando, adj. Benjamin Borden;
27 Jun 1764, p.568. £1.S15.

JOHN SMITH, 62 acs. Lunenburg Co.
on the S side of Goose Cr, adj.
Randolph; 27 Jun 1764, p.568. 10 Shill.

JOHN STEPHENSON, 54 acs. Augusta
Co. on aBr. of Naked Cr. near a Spring,
adj. Robert McCutching & his own
Land; 27 Jun 1764, p.569. 5 Shill.

HENRY SAGE, 450 acs. Lunenburg Co.
on the Brs. of Mitchel's Cr, down
Bollings Br; adj. Eastland, Lanear &
Glass; 27 Jun 1764, p.569. £2.85.
VALENTINE SEVEAR, 9% acs. or 9
acs. & 3 Roods in Augusta Co., crossing
the long Meadow, to a Stony Hill; 27 Jun
1764, p.570. 5 Shill.

LAWRENCE SUDDETH, 97 acs.
Amherst Co. on the Mountain and in the
Coves of the head of the Dutch Cr; 27
Jun 1764, p.571. 10 Shill.

JAMES TURNER, 260 acs.
Southampton Co. on the N side of
Meherin Riv., adj. sd Turners Old Line;
27 Jun 1764, p.571. £1. 65 acs. part
Gtd. John Watts by Pat. 23 Mar 1715/16
[Is. of Wight PB 10, p.259] the right &
Title whereof is since become vested in
the sd James Turner & 195 acs. the
residue never before Gtd.

JAMES TELFORD, 98 acs. Augusta Co.
on the South Mountain on the W side of
the Main Ridge of Mountains, by a
Spring of Tye River Waters, on a Lawrel
Hill; 27 Jun 1764, p.572. 10 Shill.

SIMON WILSON, 87% acs. Norfolk Co.
along a Sw. & near along the Green Sea,
adj. Simon Halsted & Edward Butt; 27
Jun 1764, p.573. 10 Shill.

JONAS WILLIAMS, 80 acs. Southampton Co. on the N side of Nottoway

Benjamin Williams, Jacob Williams &
sd Jonas Williams's other Land; 27 Jun

CHARLES WILKINS & GEORGE
WRIGHT BURGES, 46 acs. Norfolk Co.
adj. the sd Wilkins & Burges's former

ARCHIBALD WOODS, 176 acs.
Albemarle Co. on the N side of Stocktons Br. of Mechams Riv.; adj. Joseph
Kinkead, Thomas Lockhart & Adam
Gaudylock; 27 Jun 1764, p.575. £1.

JOHN COX, 1,545 acs. Lunenburg Co.
on both sides of Bluestone Cr., along
Hogans Road, down Wolf Br.; adj. Stith,
a Tract formerly Gtd. to Thomas
Williams, & Harris; 4 Aug 1764, p.576.
£5.S15. 435 acs. Part Gtd. Thomas
Williams by Pat. 20 May 1749 [PB 27,
p.207] the right & Title whereof is since
become vested in the sd John Cox &
1,110 acs. the residue never before Gtd.

DAVID CALDWELL, 355 acs. Lunenburg Co. on the E side of Cubb Cr; adj.
John Waller, Jonathan Vernon, David
Caldwell & Thomas Caldwell; 15 Aug
1764, p.578. £2. Whereas by Pat. 1 Mar
1742/43 Gtd. Richard Kennon &
William Kennon junior containing
31,700 acs. in Lunenburg Co. on the N
side of Stanton Riv. on both sides of
Cubb Cr. [Brunswick Co. PB 23, p.647]
And Whereas David Caldwell in whom
the right & Title of 9,000 acres part is
since become vested hath failed to pay
quitrents and to make Cultiv. & Improv
and John MeNees hath made humble suit
and obtained a G. for the sd 9,000 [acs.],
355 acs. part thereof the sd John McNees
hath assigned to the sd David Caldwell.

THOMAS CLARKE, JUNIOR, 400 acs.
Halifax Co. on a br. of Hunting Cr., adj.
Stovall & Cole; 15 Aug 1764, p.578. £2.
Whereas by Pat. 16 Aug 1756 Gtd.
Thomas Clarke 400 acs. in Lunenburg
Co. [PB 33, p.39] now Halifax And
whereas the sd Thomas Clarke hath
failed to pay Quitrents and to make
Cultiv. & Improv. & Thomas Clarke
junior hath made humble Suit and
obtained a G. for the same.

JOHN CLARKE, 400 acs. Halifax Co.
on hunting Cr. adj. Treadway's Land; 15
Aug 1764, p.579. £2. Whereas by Pat.
16 Aug 1756 Gtd. Thomas Clarke Senior
then in Lunenburg Co. [PB 33, p.29]
now Halifax And whereas the sd Thomas
Clarke hath failed to pay quitrents and to
made Cultiv. & Improv. and John Clarke
hath made humble Suit and obtained aG.
for the same.

THOMAS ERSKIN, 400 acs. Lunenburg
Co. on the brs. of Middle Bluestone, adj.
William Harris; 15 Aug 1764, p.580. £2.
Whereas by Pat. 19 Aug 1758 Gtd.
Alexander Erskin [Erskine in PB 33,
p.453] And Whereas the sd Alexander
Erskin hath failed to pay Quitrents and to
make Cultiv. & Improv. and Thomas
Erskin hath made humble suit and
obtained a G. for the same.

THOMAS ERSKIN, 400 acs. Lunenburg
Co. on both sides of Mitchel's Cr. adj.
Miller; 15 Aug 1764, p.581. £2.
Whereas by Pat. 19 Aug 1758 Gtd.
Alexander Erskin And whereas the sd
Alexander Erskin [Erskine in PB 33,
p.454] hath failed to pay quitrents and to
make Cultiv. & Improv. and Thomas
Erskin hath made humble Suit and
obtained a G. for the same.

ANDREW GREENHORN, 200 acs.
Louisa Co. on both sides of Gibby's Cr,
at the North fork of sd Cr, adj. sd
Donathan & George Gibson; 15 Aug
1764, p.582. £1. Whereas by Pat. 7 Aug
1752 Gtd. William Donathan [PB 31,
p.183] And whereas Joseph Standley in
whom the right & Title of sd Land is
since become vested hath failed to pay
Quitrents and to make Cultiv. & Improv.
And Andrew Greenhorn hath made
humble suit and obtained a G. for the
same.

CLEMENT READE JUNR., 8,000 acs.
Halifax Co. on both sides of Turkey
Cock Cr., crossing a head br. of Banister
Riv., to Pig Riv.; 15 Aug 1764, p.583.
£40. Whereas by Pat. 16 Aug 1756 Gtd.
Stephen Dewey, Clement Reade,
Nicholas Edmunds, Robert Jones &
Matthew Talbot [PB 33, p.49] then in
Lunenburg Co. now Halifax And
whereas the sd Dewey, Reade, Edmunds,
Jones & Talbot have failed to pay
Quitrents and to make Cultiv. & Improv.
and Clement Reade Junr. hath made
humble suit and obtained a G. for the
same.

ELISHA WHITE, 426 acs. Lunenburg
Co. on the upper side of Cubb Cr., on
Turkey Cock Br; adj. Cox, Thomas
Dugin & Grymes; 15 Aug 1764, p.584.
£2.85. Whereas by Pat. 16 Aug 1756
Gtd. Henry Hatcher [PB 34, p.105] and
whereas the sd Hatcher hath failed to pay
Quitrents and to make Cultiv. & Improv.
and Elisha White hath made humble suit
and obtained a G. for the same.

WILLIAM MOREHEAD, 57 acs.
Elizabeth City Co. on the N side of
James Riv. at a Place known by the name
of Newports news; 15 Aug 1764, p.585.
for 2 lbs. of Tobacco for every Acre of
sd Land Whereas by Inquisition
Indented and taken in Elizabeth City Co.
1 Mar 1763 by virtue of a warrant
directed to our Escheator for sd Co. It
Appears that John Taylor died seised of
57 acs. which is found to Escheat to us
from the sd John Taylor And whereas
William Morehead hath made humble
suit and obtained a G. for the same.

JOHN LYNCH, 287 acs. Halifax Co. on
the S side of Stanton Riv., adj. Valentine
Allen & Lynch in the Lowgrounds; 15
Aug 1764, p.586. 5 Shill. 272 acs. part
formerly Gtd. Mary Jennings by Pat. 4
Jul 1759 [PB 33, p.595] the right & title
whereof is since become vested in the sd
John Lynch; and 15 acs. the residue
never before Gtd.

LUNSFORD LOMAX, 3,553 acs.
Amherst Co. on the head of Horseley Cr.
and in the Coves of the Tobacco row
Mountain on the N side, crossing Little
Cr. adj. Charles Taliaferro; 15 Aug
1764, p.587. £10.S5. 1,504 acs. part
Gtd. sd Lunsford Lomax by 4 separate
Patents, 2 of them for 400 acs. each
dated 12 Jul 1750, another for 304 acs.
dated the same day [Albemarle Co. PB
29, p.329 & PB 30, p.196, p.198 &
p.199], and the other 400 acs. dated 3
Nov 1750 And 2,049 acs. the residue
never before Gtd.

RAMAN ENNIS, 160 acs. Southampton
Co. in Nottoway Par., to the main Run of
the Angelica Sw. thence down Thomas
Jarrels Mill Pond; adj. Thomas Jarrell,
William Matthews, Solomon Stevenson,
Ralph Matthews & the sd Ennis's old
line; 15 Aug 1764, p.588. 10 Shill. 100
acs. part Gtd. Hugh Matthews by Pat. 23
Mar 1715/16 [Is. of Wight Co. PB 10.
p.257] the right & title whereof is since
become vested in the sd Raman Ennis &
60 acs. the residue never before Gtd.

CRISPIN SHELTON, 1,515 acs. Halifax
Co. on both sides of the North fork of
Panther Cr. & it's Brs.; adj. Wade,
Edward Haley, James Haley, Lightfoot &
Coleman; 15 Aug 1764, p.589. £1.S10.
200 acs. part being part of a Pat. of 400
acs. Gtd. George Whitton 25 Oct 1753
[345 acs. in PB 32, p.270?], 238 acs.
other part Gtd. sd Whitton the same day
{Lunenburgh Co. PB 32, p.268], 400
acs. other part Gtd. Erasmas Weathers
Allen by Pat. 15 Dec 1755 [PB 32,
p.663], 386 acs. other part Gtd. Ambrose
Haley by Pat. 15 Dec 1757 [336 acs. in
PB 34, p.206] the right & title whereof is
since become vested in the sd Crispin
Shelton And 291 acs. the residue never
before Gtd.

THOMAS SHIVERS, 500 acs. Nansemond Co. in Wainoak Neck, along &
through the Horsepen Pocoson, at the
head of the Juniper Pocoson, on the
Brink of Black Water Riv.; adj. James
Norfleet, John Cole, John Lawrence,
Benjamin Baker & George Lawrence; 15
Aug 1764, p.590. £2. 100 acs. part ofa
Pat. of 200 acs. Gtd. John Lawrence 14
Feb 1761 [PB 33, p.972] the right & title
whereof is since become vested in the sd
Thomas Shivers & 400 acs. the residue
never before Gtd.

WILLIS RIDDICK, 353 acs. Nansemond
Co. at a place called the White Marsh,
Beg. in the Great Sw., by the side of the
high Road, up the Back Br; adj. John
Camble, Wright, & Ezekias Riddick; 15
Aug 1764, p.591. £1.S5. 145 acs. part
being part of a Pat. for 2,250 acs. Gtd.
William Wright 18 Mar 1662/63 [15 Feb
1655/56 in PB 4, p.9(13)] the Right &
Title of which sd 145 acs. is since
become vested in the sd William Riddick
and 208 acs. the residue never before
Gtd.
ISAAC LEDBETTER, 2, 182 acs. Brunswick Co. on the S side of Rattlesnake
Cr.; adj. his own line, Johnson, Mirick,
Jones, Fletcher, Clanton & Smith; 15
Aug 1764, p.592. £10.85. 172 acs. part
Gtd. Richard Ledbetter by Pat. 16 Jun
1738 [PB 18, p.13 to Richard Letbetter
Junr.] the right & Title whereof is since
become vested in the sd Isaac Ledbetter
& 2,010 acs. the residue never before
Gtd.

GEORGE LONG, 920 acs. Sussex Co.
on the S side of Nottoway Riv., up the
Spring sw., up Ralph's Br. near where
the mouth of the blue marsh Br. makes
into Rackoon sw.; adj. sd Long, John
Richardson, James Cooper, John
Hargrove, Thomas Dunn Junr, Amos
Atkins, Edward Skelton, Gregory
Rowlings Senr., Richard Rowlings & his
Brother Gregory Rowlings Junr,
Thomas Newsum & Thomas Battle; 15
Aug 1764, p.594. £3. 265 acs. part Gtd.
sd George Long by pat. 25 Sep 1746
[Surry Co. PB 24, p.532], 100 acs other
part Gtd. William Tomlinson by Pat. 5
Sep 1723 [Surry Co. PB 11, p.272] the
right & title whereof is since become
vested in the sd George Long and 555
acs. the residue never before gtd.

ANTHONY IRBY, 774 acs. Halifax Co.
on both sides of Banister Riv. and Brush
Cr., Beg. on the S side the sd Riv. just
below the upper great falls; 15 Aug
1764, p.595. £2. 400 acs. part Gtd.
Hugh Miller by Pat. 19 May 1749
{Lunenburg Co. PB 27, p.201 or p.203
dated 20 May 1749] the right & title
whereof is since become vested in the sd
Anthony Irby And 374 acs. the residue
never before Gtd.

RICHARD ADAMS, 5,470 acs. Halifax
Co. on the brs. of Gobling town Cr,
Beg. in a fork of sd Cr, crossing
Sycamore Cr. & a br. of Mayo Riv., at
the head Spring of Gobling town Cr;
adj. Isham Barnett & William Barnett;
15 Aug 1764, p.596. £27.S10.

Co. on the East br. of Flat Cr; adj.

p.598. 10 Shill.

the South Mountain on the W side of the
main ridge; 15 Aug 1764, p.599. 10
Shill.

Par. of Nansemond Co. on the Great sw.
or desert; adj. Jotham Lauler/Lauter,
James Booth Senr. & Henry Riddick; 15
Aug 1764, p.599. 10 Shill.

JAMES BEARD, 96 acs. Augusta Co. on

1764, p.600. 10 Shill.

dated 20 Sep 1768]

Aug 1764, p.603. 15 Shill.

Riv. on Shepherds Cr.; crossing the

[Regranted to Elijah Stone in PB 42,
p.871 dated 7 Dec 1774]

JOSEPH BYRD, 250 acs. Halifax Co. on
both sides of the South Br. of Blackwater
Riv.; adj. his own line & Daniel Donaho;
15 Aug 1764, p.604. £1.S5.

p.606. £1.85.

on both sides of Sandy Cr; 15 Aug
1764, p.606. £2.S5.

JOHN BUTLER, 400 acs. Halifax Co.
on both sides of Sandy Cr. of Dan Riv.,
adj. Abel Lee & Roberts; 15 Aug 1764,
p.607. £2.

fork, crossing 2 bold Brs.; 15 Aug 1764,

JOHN EMNS, 50 acs. Henrico Co. adj.
Daniel Warren & Humphry Smith; 15

EDMUND COVINGTON, 140 acs.
Lunenburg Co. on the brs. of the Great
Cr., up the spring br., adj. Samford; 15

JOSEPH COLLINS, 400 acs. Halifax
Co. on the Brs. of straight Stone Cr. and
the North end of Allens Creek Mountain,
adj. Daniel Hamblin & Isaac Echold; 15
Aug 1764, p.609. £2.

EDWARD CAHALL, 217 acs. Halifax
Co. on the brs. of the East fork of
Cascade Cr.; adj. Robert Waltin, Cargill,
& Edward Sweeting; 15 Aug 1764,
p.610. £1.85.

JOHN CAMPBELL, I11 acs.
Nansemond Co. in the upper Par. of sd
Co. at a Place known by the name of
Whitemarsh, Beg. in the sd Campbells
old field, into the great sw., adj. sd
Campbell & Willis Riddick; 15 Aug
1764, p.611. 15 Shill.
BOWLER DOBYNS, 400 acs.

WINDLE EVERT, 300 acs. Augusta Co.

WILLIAM FOX, 202 acs. Brunswick

£1.

THOMAS FISHER, 132 acs. in the

WILLIAM FERRALL, 485 acs. Bedford

JOHN FOUTCH, 290 acs. Augusta Co.
on a hill near Shanando Riv., adj.
Hernsberger's Survey, the land he lives

JOHN FRY, 400 acs. Albemarle Co. on
both sides Bryery Cr. of Hardware Riv.,
adj. Royalty; 15 Aug 1764, p.617. £2.

GEORGE FENTRESS, 354 acs. of
Cypress Swamp Land in Norfolk Co. &
the Par. of Saint Bride, in the mouth of
the Crooked run, crossing the Cypress
br.; adj. the High land of the sd George
Fentress, David McClenahan & Jeremiah
Murden his high land; 15 Aug 1764,
p-617. £1.S15.

WILLIAM GRAIG, 394 acs. Albemarle
Co. on the brs. of Stockton's Cr. of
Meechum's Riv., adj. John Chiswell; 15
Aug 1764, p.618. £2.

THOMAS GOODWYNNE, 100 acs.
Sussex Co., Beg. in William Eldridges
Path, adj. the sd Eldridge; 15 Aug 1764,
p-619. 10 Shill.

THOMAS GRISAM, 400 acs. Halifax
Co. on both sides the South fork of
Sandy Riv., adj. Wamack; 15 Aug 1764,
p.619. £2.

HUMPHRY GRIFFIN, 253 acs. Nansemond Co. on the great Dismal sw. at a
Place called the Cypress, on the edge of
the High Land, adj. sd Griffin & John
Brinkly/Brinkley; 15 Aug 1764, p.620.
£1.S15.
GEORGE GRIFFITH, 60 acs. Bedford
Co. on both sides of Black water riv.,
adj. his own Patent line; 15 Aug 1764,
p.620. 10 Shill.

BENJAMIN GRANGER, 200 acs.
Chesterfield Co. on the lower side of
Stoney/Stony Cr; adj. his old lines,
James Moore & George Plot; 15 Aug
1764, p.621. £1.

JAMES & CHARLES HUNT, 820 acs.
Halifax Co. on both sides of the middle
fork of Strait Stone Cr, adj. Mayes &
Barker; 15 Aug 1764, p.622. £4.85.

WILLIAM GRIFFIN, 220 acs. Pr
Edward Co. adj. his own old Patent
